intro: Navarretia hamata subsp. foliacea, commonly known as the leafy navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Navarretia hamata subsp. foliacea is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
